{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3300952,"name":"Endrew","username":"EndrewBortoli9458","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/endrewbortoli9458/{size}/207233_2.png","created_at":"2024-02-03T15:23:24.429Z","cooked":"

Hi, I already got to implement the PathPlanner code in my code, however, the turning does not work. I do not have a video, but I can describe what is happening, so what is happening is that even when making the robot turn in the PathPlanner when It runs it does not turn correctly as shown in the PathPlanner software, the turning that should happen in the middle of the auto happens in the end, and it do not turn correctly, this is a example:

This is a turning path to launch, so the Robot is 0 degrees and is returning next to the subwoofer with 180 degrees of rotation. The robot does the path as expected, the robot does not turn during the path, instead, it turns at the final of the path and the robot that is 180 degrees does not turn more than 10 degrees and the robot stops. So are 2 problems, the robot does not turn during the path and does not turn the amount that it should.

This is my project link in GitHub:

GitHub

GitHub - EndrewBortoli/AutonomousCode

Contribute to EndrewBortoli/AutonomousCode development by creating an account on GitHub.

PathPlanner Auto Going Off Path When Rotating Programming
PathPlanner is not meant for doing turn in place. That will create a pretty busted spline and cause a bunch of issues. If you want to turn in place, you need to create a separate command to do that yourself.

This doesn’t sound like quite the same problem we are having but i will point you to the post I have been on.

PathPlanner Auto Going Off Path When Rotating Programming
@mjansen4857 Unfortunately, that was not the solution to our issue. Not sure why the bumper colors are wrong (I was switching between driver stations so that might affect things), but the below is from some testing tonight. Thanks for all the help. Code Log file [odom_replay_2] [odom_replay_shimmy]

You can’t rotate while driving fast, there is not enough module speed left over to do so. PP limits rotation speed in favor of translation speed/accuracy. You need to slow down the translation speed along the path if you want to rotate over a short distance like that.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2024-02-03T17:54:30.920Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":9,"reads":71,"readers_count":70,"score":79.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":453195,"topic_slug":"urgent-pathplanner-do-not-turning-the-robot","display_username":"Michael Jansen","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":61783,"username":"EndrewBortoli9458","name":"Endrew","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/endrewbortoli9458/{size}/207233_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":33850,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"3015 Programming Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/urgent-pathplanner-do-not-turning-the-robot/453195/6","custom_user_title":"3015 Programming Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3301043,"name":"Michael Jansen","username":"mjansen4857","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mjansen4857/{size}/201972_2.png","created_at":"2024-02-03T17:55:36.650Z","cooked":"

Also, your max module speed is wrong.

Set that to the actual max speed of your modules.
